intro: Geissaspis apiculata, commonly known as the apiculate geissaspis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its fruits are dry, three-angled berries that release tiny seeds when mature. Geissaspis apiculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
